meanings.definition: To shorten or distort an object in a drawing or painting in order to create the illusion of depth.
meanings.sent1: When I draw, I use foreshortening to make things look far away.
meanings.sent2: Artists often use foreshortening to make their paintings more realistic.
meanings.sent3: The cartoonist exaggerated the foreshortening of the character's arm for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: Her use of foreshortening in the landscape painting made the mountains seem closer than they were.
meanings.sent5: The art teacher explained foreshortening by showing how to make objects appear distant on paper.

meanings.definition: The technique of representing an object or figure in a picture in depth by shortening the lines in the drawing.
meanings.sent1: The artist's skillful foreshortening made the portrait look three-dimensional.
meanings.sent2: Foreshortening is important in creating realistic perspective in art.
meanings.sent3: The foreshortening of the bridge in the painting gave it a unique visual appeal.
meanings.sent4: In the artwork, the foreshortening of the tree branches symbolized growth and change.
meanings.sent5: The art student practiced foreshortening by drawing a vase from different angles.
